title: Ticket #175: Create and document some SOAP examples in one of the trendy languages.
description: It would be nice to have some samples that demonstrate using Condor via the SOAP interface. These examples could do simple things like being a basic condor_q or more be slightly more complex and demonstrate how to submit a job. It seems to make sense to write these in some of the more trendy languages, like Python, Perl, PHP, C#, etc. since they will most likely be of interest to the build of our current and future SOAP users (my choice of languages is purely a conjecture, but I believe it is well founded, given the current interest in web-services and the relation between them and these languages).
remarks:
2009-Mar-12 11:45:51 by gthain:
Trendy? PHP? I've got some samples in Javascript that rock.

2009-Mar-12 19:21:24 by matt:
I've done the Java w/ Axis stuff already, C/C++ with gSOAP, and even C# w/ .Net or Mono. At one point there was Python w/ ZSI and Todd had some Perl example, which sometimes worked. Why not go for Python with SUDS, https://fedorahosted.org/suds/?

2009-Oct-21 15:32:50 by psilord:
Ben Burnett has left the Condor Project. This ticket is being unassigned.

2012-Dec-04 14:54:47 by smoler:
Resolving old ticket. Enough info is on the wiki, and is not going to go into the manual.

See SoapWisdom for some SOAP guidance.
creator: burnett
